eu.davidea.flexibleadapter.utils

Class Log

  • java.lang.Object
    • eu.davidea.flexibleadapter.utils.Log

  • public class Log
extends java.lang.Object
    Utility class for Android libraries, that simplifies the use of Log by improving the call to all log methods by supplying arguments as parameters '%s' instead of creating a string. This avoids useless memory allocations when not requested: the StringBuilder itself, the buffer and the String object. The new methods check in advance if the level is enabled and only after the string message with arguments is created.

    Note: This class can work in collaboration with Logger.

    Others features are:

    • Automatic TAG corresponding to the caller class name.
    • Runtime log level without the need of props file (useful for libraries).
    • Method name with line number.

    Use Log.Level.SUPPRESS to disable all logs. For instance:

     if (BuildConfig.DEBUG) {
     Log.setLevel(Level.INFO);
 } else {
     Log.setLevel(Level.SUPPRESS);
 }
 Log.i("Message arg1=%s, arg2=%s", arg1, arg2);
    Since:
    02/06/2017
    See Also:
    Logger

    • Method Detail

      • setLevel

        public static void setLevel(int level)

      • logMethodName

        public static void logMethodName(boolean method,
                                 boolean line)
        Allows to log method name and line number from where the log is called.

        - With method name: [method] msg.
        - With line number: [method:line] msg.

        Note: Line number needs method name enabled.
        Parameters:
        method - true to print method name at the beginning of the message, false otherwise
        line - true to print line number after the method name, false otherwise

        msg - the message you would like logged
        args - the extra arguments for the message

      • iTag

        public static void iTag(java.lang.String tag,
                        java.lang.String msg,
                        java.lang.Object... args)
        As i(String, Object...) but with custom tag for one call only.
        Parameters:
        tag - custom tag, used to identify the source of a log message
        msg - the message you would like logged
        args - the extra arguments for the message

      • useTag

        public static void useTag(@Nullable
                          java.lang.String customTag)
        Sets a general static custom tag for ALL log calls.

        Note: If a Logger instance is created, this custom tag will be reset to null and current filename will be used instead.

        Parameters:
        customTag - general static tag for ALL logs.
